name: Discussing Maharishi & the TM Movement, etc.

episodes.title: The Subtler Forms of Coercive Control, Part I
episodes.description:
Is the Transcendental Meditation movement founded by “His Holiness” Maharishi Mahesh Yogi a cult? There's been some debate about the use of the word cult. Some say it is overused and imprecise. An expression favoured these days is ''high control organization'' or ''high demand group''. A case can be made that many who have gone on further in the TM organisation, becoming teachers and leaders, have been subject to high control, albeit in a subtle form.

Some of the subtler elements of coercive control can be:

an atmosphere where people are trained to gaslight themselves. For example, a situation may have been brought about where if the leadership behaves in puzzling ways, people will nonetheless speculate in their favour. “Oh, they must have done it for (this) reason.” The concept of “higher” states of consciousness and the assumption that some leaders have attained them, favours such an atmosphere.
an atmosphere where once the neophyte has become absorbed into the “priesthood” it is gently implied that there is something wrong with them if they engage in critical thinking — discussion and debate on points of doctrine.
an atmosphere where those raising even very standard questions about, for example, financial accountability, are disadvantaged. This will be the case, for example, if such questions are characterised as “drops of poison."
Few would argue that people learning the basic entry level of Transcendental Meditation are subjected to coercive control. However, they have put a foot on the first rung of the ladder, and moving them up the ladder is baked into the “TM” teaching process.

Features:

episodes.title: Maharishi After Dark - The Many Loves of the Yogi : The HIVE Part 6
episodes.description:
TO VIEW ALL of the HIVE interviews, click here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKBs6D549xGsJVRKl1rslZw 

CONVERSATIONS IN THE HIVE PART SIX: Susan Shumsky  is a former staff member at the TM headquarters in Seelisberg, Switzerland, and is a best selling author of 20 books. She also features in the movie The Beatles in India.

In this video Susan documents the sexual relationships Maharishi had with many women. She also discusses the complicated nature of these relationships, and the assignations that happened "after dark" - after 3am in most cases.

Susan is joined by a number of other speakers, in particular Conny Larsson, who was employed as Maharishi's masseur and personal secretary. He was unwittingly responsible for bringing many of the young women to Maharishi in the dead of night.
